title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.6 | 27-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiraandasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: For a living being, there is no one dearer than the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse and explains that everyone has a loving relationship with Krishna, but we have forgotten it.

segments.key_quote: Lord Krishna has got His own expansions, His personal expansions.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the concepts of Svamsa (personal expansions of Krishna) and Vibhinamsa (living beings as expansions of Krishna's energy).

segments.key_quote: Without the living being, the material body has no value.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the difference between Paramatma (Swamsa) and Jivatma (Vibhinamsa) and emphasizes the importance of the soul within the body.

themes: Krishna as the Supreme Personality of Godhead
segments.key_quote: Krishna is the Supreme Personality of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Brahman and Paramatma are expansions of Krishna and do not have independent existence, emphasizing Krishna's supreme position.

segments.key_quote: Actually none of them are independent of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by stating that everything is interrelated and dependent on Krishna, who is the ultimate source.
